page.title: 08BUILDINGS IN THE BIBURY AREA
page.content: Most buildings date from the 17th century, being built of cotswold stone walls, mullion windows and high pitched roofs of cotswold stone tiles. They were originally built as part of a large agricultural estate. Many of the old barns and buildings have been converted to residential use. There are now fewer tenants, many houses being privately owned. Some are only used as weekend and holiday homes. There are two large houses of note in the area, Barnsley Park, which is still a privately owned house, was built in 1720_31, and stands in its own landscaped parkland. Bibury Court is an impressive house dating from Tudor times. It was greatly extended around 1630 to form a large manor house. Since 1968 it has been a hotel used by visitors from all over the world and by local people.
